Bootstrapping some of the relations
===================================
AIC score is defined as
$$
AIC = -2\, \log \textrm{likelihood} + 2\, k
$$
where $k$ is the number of parameters in the model.
This means the lower, the better. In the following, the full model has $k=3$,
no interaction has $k=2$ and both age only and shot only have $k=1$.

```{r ic_h2_boot}
ic_h2_aic <- bs_AIC(ic_data, "H2_log", k=200)
boxplot(ic_h2_aic)
title("AIC score for IC50, H2")
```

```{r ec_h1pdm09_boot}
ec_h1pdm_aic <- bs_AIC(ec_data, "H1_pdm09_log", k=200)
boxplot(ec_h1pdm_aic)
title("AIC score for EC50, H1 pandemic 2009")
```

```{r ec_h12_boot}
ec_h12_aic <- bs_AIC(ec_data, "H12_log", k=200)
boxplot(ec_h12_aic)
title("AIC score for EC50, H12")
```
